title: Signing On For Duty
description: Procedures for signing on including safety critical license requirements, document checks, and readiness statement

flashcards.question: What action would you take if you forget/lose your safety critical licence?
flashcards.answer: Report it to your SPM and request a temporary paper copy of your licence.

flashcards.question: What checks should be made regarding relevant publications?
flashcards.answer: You must check all relevant publications are current and you have access to them.

flashcards.question: What notices cases should be checked when signing on?
flashcards.answer: Late notice case, Train crew notice case, Roster notice case, Incident notice case, Low adhesion notice case.

flashcards.question: What is your understanding of the statement for readiness for duty?
flashcards.answer: That you are in compliance with the Drugs & Alcohol policy and, to the best of your knowledge, you are fit to drive trains. You are in full uniform provided and have, in your possession or have access to, all relevant publications, licences, equipment and operating notices which you require during your turn of duty. You have read any notices pertinent to your turn of duty. If you wear corrective glasses, unless in possession of written authorisation, that you have two pairs in your possession (where required). You must meet all this criteria before signing on for duty.

flashcards.question: What personal equipment checks should be made when signing on?
flashcards.answer: Check all required PPE and equipment is present, serviceable, and complies with standards.

flashcards.question: Why is it important to check the notice cases when signing on?
flashcards.answer: To ensure you are aware of any operational changes, safety information, or other critical updates that may affect your duty.

flashcards.question: How do you confirm you are fit for duty?
flashcards.answer: By signing the statement of readiness for duty, confirming you are not under the influence of drugs or alcohol, have had sufficient rest, and are medically fit to perform safety critical work.

flashcards.question: What information should you check on the roster notice case?
flashcards.answer: To check you are on the right job, see if your job has altered workings (AW), and to check your next shift.

flashcards.question: What information would you find in the late notice case?
flashcards.answer: Emergency speed restrictions, ice mode activation and any other safety of the line notices e.g. color of low adhesion day, register.

flashcards.question: How long will a notice be posted in the late notice case?
flashcards.answer: Posted for 72 hours (ESR's can be re-issued or entered in W.O.N then they become TSR's).

flashcards.question: What information would you find in the train crew notice case?
flashcards.answer: Notices moved from late notice case, Traction notices, any other non-safety of the line notices, register.

flashcards.question: How long will a notice be posted in the train crew notice case?
What information would you find in the incident notice case?
flashcards.answer: Recent operational incidents, list of multi SPAD signals, register.

flashcards.question: How long will a notice be posted in the incident notice case?
flashcards.answer: 4 weeks, multi SPAD signal list stays in there permanently.

flashcards.question: What information would you find in the health and safety notice case?
flashcards.answer: First aid arrangements, authorised walking routes, H&S policy statement, care first policy, phone numbers.

flashcards.question: How long will a notice be posted in the health and safety notice case?
flashcards.answer: Stays in permanently or until updated.

quiz.question: What should you do if you forget your safety critical license?
options: You cannot sign on for duty
Report to your SPM and request a temporary paper copy
Sign on but avoid any safety critical work

quiz.question: What is part of the statement of readiness for duty?
options: You have completed all required training
You have permission from your manager to sign on
You are in compliance with the Drugs & Alcohol policy
You have signed all necessary HR paperwork

quiz.question: What must you have if you wear corrective glasses?
How long will notices be posted in the late notice case?
How long will notices be posted in the train crew notice case?
What information would you find in the late notice case?
options: Emergency speed restrictions and safety of the line notices

quiz.question: What is the purpose of checking the incident notice case?
options: To find out about disciplinary matters
To see if any colleagues have been involved in incidents
To be aware of recent operational incidents and multi SPAD signals
To check the time of your next shift

quiz.question: What should you check in the roster notice case?
options: Your correct job, altered workings, and next shift

quiz.question: How long does the multi SPAD signal list remain in the incident notice case?
What should you do if you notice your PPE is damaged when signing on?
options: Sign on anyway and report it later
Contact driver manager or depot manager immediately
